content.description:
After starting at the same location as Progression Obsession traverse right to a small left facing corner protected by a bolt. Climb up to gain a large ledge. From a stance on top of a large block trend right onto the face and climb to the top. Rappel route is the down Progression Obsession. Unlike Progression Obsession this climb is too long to do without using the intermediate belay station.

Start at the parking lot by the Parmenter road access. Walk slightly North-East to Candy box. Continue up the steep trail 6 minutes just past Wet Cedar about 30m.
Two hangars with rings at top. 3 bolts, Gear to 3.5", and double length runners.

Start on a large boulder and make a thin move to clip the first bolt. Continue with a series
of dynamic moves on great holds gain a large ledge. From a small chimney featurec limb up and left on the ramp to the rap rings

Between Wet Cedar and Progression Obsession, find a rope to assist you to gain the higher bench. Trend right into a larger corner to the base of the route.
Two hangars with rings at top. 4 bolts, gear to 2".

Start on low angle featured face past two bolts. Climb past intermediate rappel anchors, using edges and flakes to gain the large angled ledge on the right. Finish direct to the top with thin lay-back moves to a stance before reaching the anchors. This climb can be done in one pitch with a 70m rope.

Start at the parking lot by the Parmenter road access. Walk slightly North-East to Candy box. Continue up the steep trail 6 minutes just past Wet Cedar about 30m.
Two hangars with rings at top. 6 bolts, gear to 3.5".

Stem and jam up a shallow alcove to a thin finger problem at the top. Make your way up another block to the anchors.

From the top of Progression Obsession climb follow the small trail gaining the ledge and then left to where the obvious crack is seen.
Two hangars with rings at top. Gear to 3.5".
Interesting crack climbing, most of which is mixed.
